user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_pool_destroy:
```c
void
MHD_pool_destroy (struct MemoryPool *pool)
{
  if (NULL == pool)
    return;

  mhd_assert (pool->end >= pool->pos);
  mhd_assert (pool->size >= pool->end - pool->pos);
  mhd_assert (pool->pos == ROUND_TO_ALIGN (pool->pos));
  _MHD_UNPOISON_MEMORY (pool->memory, pool->size);
  if (! pool->is_mmap)
    free (pool->memory);
  else
#if defined(MAP_ANONYMOUS) && ! defined(_WIN32)
    munmap (pool->memory,
            pool->size);
#elif defined(_WIN32)
    VirtualFree (pool->memory,
                 0,
                 MEM_RELEASE);
#else
    abort ();
#endif
  free (pool);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_pool_destroy:
#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)
...
#define ROUND_TO_ALIGN(n) (((n)+(ALIGN_SIZE-1))/(ALIGN_SIZE)*(ALIGN_SIZE))
...
#define _MHD_UNPOISON_MEMORY(pointer, size) (void)0
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No suspicious fragments found for Rule 17.2 (no direct or indirect self-calls).

Reasoning:
- The function body does not contain any textually visible call to MHD_pool_destroy (no direct recursion).
- The provided macros expand to no function calls: mhd_assert -> ((void)0), _MHD_UNPOISON_MEMORY -> (void)0, ROUND_TO_ALIGN -> arithmetic expression. These cannot introduce indirect calls to MHD_pool_destroy.
- The remaining calls are to standard runtime/OS functions (free, munmap, VirtualFree, abort). In C these do not invoke user-defined callbacks or destructors and do not call back into program functions such as MHD_pool_destroy, so they cannot create indirect recursion.
- There are no function-pointer calls, callbacks, or other constructs in this fragment that could hide an indirect call path to MHD_pool_destroy.

Therefore no code fragment in the provided function needs investigation for violating Rule 17.2.
